meanings.definition: In a manner indicating anger or annoyance.
meanings.sent1: She stomped indignly out of the room after being scolded.
meanings.sent2: He glared indignly at his brother for eating the last cookie.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed indignly when it saw the empty food bowl.
meanings.sent4: The storm clouds gathered indignly in the sky, ready to unleash their fury.
meanings.sent5: The teacher's voice rose indignly as she reprimanded the students for talking during the lesson.

meanings.definition: In a way that shows a feeling of being treated unfairly.
meanings.sent1: The child pouted indignly when he was not allowed to join the game.
meanings.sent2: She crossed her arms indignly, feeling left out of the group.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel chattered indignly at the bird stealing its nuts.
meanings.sent4: The old house groaned indignly as the wind rattled its windows.
meanings.sent5: The flowers wilted indignly under the scorching sun, longing for water.
